title: How to Analyse a Case Study

steps.title: Describe the nature of the organization under consideration and its competitors.
steps.content: Describe the nature of the organization under consideration and its competitors. Provide general information about the market and customer base. Indicate any significant changes in the business environment or any new endeavors upon which the business is embarking.

steps.title: Analyze its management structure, employee base, and financial history.
steps.content: Analyze its management structure, employee base, and financial history. Describe annual revenues and profit. Provide figures on employment. Include details about private ownership, public ownership, and investment holdings. Provide a brief overview of the business's leaders and command chain. [1] X Research source

steps.title: In all likelihood, there will be several different factors at play.
steps.content: In all likelihood, there will be several different factors at play. Decide which is the main concern of the case study by examining what most of the data talks about, the main problems facing the business, and the conclusions at the end of the study. Examples might include expansion into a new market, response to a competitor's marketing campaign, or a changing customer base. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Trace a chronological progression of steps taken (or not taken).
steps.content: Trace a chronological progression of steps taken (or not taken). Draw on the information you gathered, and cite data included in the case study, such as increased marketing spending, purchasing of new property, changed revenue streams, etc.

steps.title: Suggest alternative or improved measures that could have been taken.
steps.content: Suggest alternative or improved measures that could have been taken. Use specific examples and backing up your suggestions with data and calculations.

steps.title: Explain what you'd do to arrive at the measures you proposed.
steps.content: Explain what you'd do to arrive at the measures you proposed. Include any changes to organization, strategy, and management you'd make. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Emphasize what you would do differently in the case.
steps.content: Emphasize what you would do differently in the case. Showcase both your understanding of the case study and your business strategy. [5] X Research source
